Question Text: Which of the following terms describe Ethernet addresses that can send one frame and is delivered to multiple devices on the LAN? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Broadcast address
b. Multicast address
c. IP address
d. MAC address
e. Unicast address
LLM Explanation: Broadcast address and Multicast address are the terms used to describe Ethernet addresses that can send one frame and are delivered to multiple devices on the LAN. A broadcast address is used to send data to all devices on the network, while a multicast address is used to send data to a specific group of devices.

Question Text: ___________ is a set of rules determining how network devices respond when two devices attempt to use a data channel simultaneously and encounter a data collision.
Choices:
a. CSMA/CD
b. CSMA/CA
c. TCP/IP
d. TCP/UDP
LLM Explanation: The correct option is a. CSMA/CD. CSMA/CD stands for Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection. It is a set of rules used in Ethernet networks to manage how devices respond when they detect that two devices are trying to transmit data at the same time. In such cases, a collision is detected, and CSMA/CD helps in handling these collisions by backing off and retransmitting the data after a random time interval to avoid further collisions.

Question Text: Ethernet standard ___________ BASE-T defines Gigabit Ethernet over UTP cabling.
LLM Explanation: The Ethernet standard 1000BASE-T defines Gigabit Ethernet over UTP cabling. The '1000' in 1000BASE-T signifies the speed of 1000 Mbps or 1 Gbps, which is the Gigabit Ethernet speed.

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer Fields allows devices on the network to easily synchronize their receiver clocks?
Choices:
a. Frame Check Sequence
b. Data and Pad
c. Start Frame Delimiter
d. Preamble
LLM Explanation: The field that allows devices on the network to easily synchronize their receiver clocks is the Preamble. It consists of a 56-bit pattern of alternating 1s and 0s, which helps in synchronization and allows devices to detect the start of a frame.

Question Text: The host sends packets to its default gateway if the ____________ IP address is in a different subnet than the host.
Choices:
a. Source
b. Destination
c. Unicast
d. Broadcast
LLM Explanation: The host sends packets to its default gateway if the destination IP address is in a different subnet than the host. The default gateway serves as the exit point for packets to reach destinations outside the local subnet.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Application TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) resides in the Application layer of the TCP/IP model. It is responsible for sending and receiving email.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Transport TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: The TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) resides in the Transport layer of the TCP/IP model. It is responsible for providing reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data between applications.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Internet TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) and IP (Internet Protocol) both reside in the Internet TCP/IP Architecture layer. TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data, while IP is responsible for addressing and routing packets of data so that they can travel across networks.
SM - Description: Seems like it didn’t understand the goal of the question - e.g. it’s not asking about TCP/IP architecture but the internet layer of TCP/IP. Confirmed by rewriting the question and asking get 3.5 again

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Data Link & Physical TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: Ethernet protocol resides in the Data Link layer of the TCP/IP Architecture. It is responsible for the physical transmission of data between network devices.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols is used from PC1 to learn information from some other device on the same network?
Choices:
a. ping
b. ARP
c. DHCP
d. DNS
LLM Explanation: The correct protocol used from PC1 to learn information from some other device on the same network is ARP (Address Resolution Protocol). ARP is used to map an IP address to a MAC address within the local network. When a device needs to communicate with another device on the same network, it uses ARP to discover the MAC address of the target device.

Question Text: If the devices below were connected with UTP Ethernet cables, which pairs of devices would require a straight-through cable? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Router and PC
b. Switch and PC
c. Hub and switch
d. Router and hub
LLM Explanation: Devices that require a straight-through cable are those that have different wiring schemes on their Ethernet ports. A straight-through cable is used to connect devices with different types of ports, where the transmit pins on one device are connected to the receive pins on the other. In this case, a router and a PC, as well as a hub and a switch, have different wiring schemes on their ports and would require a straight-through cable.
SM - Description: Correct concept but wrong facts (e.g. router and PC being dissimilar)

Question Text: Which of the following protocols are examples of TCP/IP data-link layer protocols? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. TCP
b. HTTP
c. Ethernet
d. PPP
e. SMTP
f. HTTPS
LLM Explanation: The correct options for TCP/IP data-link layer protocols are Ethernet (c) and PPP (d). Ethernet is a widely used LAN technology, and PPP is commonly used for establishing a direct connection between two networking nodes.

Question Text: Which of the following statements are functions of a routing protocol? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Learning routes and putting those routes into the routing table for routes advertised to the router by its neighboring routers
b. Advertising known routes to neighboring routers
c. Learning routes for subnets directly connected to the router
d. Forwarding IP packets based on a packet’s destination IP address
LLM Explanation: A routing protocol is responsible for learning routes from neighboring routers and putting those routes into the routing table (option a). Additionally, it advertises known routes to neighboring routers to share routing information (option b). Learning routes for directly connected subnets (option c) and forwarding IP packets based on destination IP address (option d) are functions of a router, not specifically a routing protocol.

Question Text: When you open a web browser and type in the hostname www.examsdigest.com, your computer does not send an IP packet with a destination IP address www.examsdigest.com; it sends an IP packet to an IP address used by the web server for Examsdigest. TCP/IP needs a way to let a computer find the IP address used by the listed hostname. That method uses the Domain Name System (DNS).
LLM Explanation: The statement is true. When a user types in a hostname like www.examsdigest.com, the computer uses the Domain Name System (DNS) to resolve this hostname to an IP address before establishing a connection. DNS is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses to locate resources on the internet.

Question Text: A __________________ address is an address that enables transmission to every node in a local network.
Choices:
a. Broadcast
b. Multicast
c. Unicast
d. MAC
LLM Explanation: A broadcast address is used to transmit data to all nodes in a local network. When a device sends data to the broadcast address, it is received by all devices within the network.

Question Text: TCP and ______________ are the two most commonly used TCP/IP transport layer protocols.
Choices:
a. UDP
b. HTTP
c. DNS
d. SMTP
LLM Explanation: The correct option is UDP (User Datagram Protocol). TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) and UDP (User Datagram Protocol) are the two most commonly used TCP/IP transport layer protocols. While TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented communication, UDP offers faster but unreliable, connectionless communication.

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer Fields provides a method for the receiving NIC to determine whether the frame experienced transmission errors?
Choices:
a. Frame Check Sequence
b. Data and Pad
c. Start Frame Delimiter
d. Preamble
LLM Explanation: The Frame Check Sequence (FCS) field in the IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer is used to provide a method for the receiving NIC to determine whether the frame experienced transmission errors. It is a crucial part of error detection in Ethernet frames.
